sentences.en: A judge may have to sort out the immediate squabble.
sentences.cn: 法官可能不得不解决当前的争吵.

sentences.en: Babbitt did not often squabble with his employees.
sentences.cn: 巴比特不常和雇员争吵.

sentences.en: Besides, the invariable squabble for money on Saturday nights had begun to weary her unspeakably.
sentences.cn: 另外, 每星期六都为了钱而发生的争吵已使她开始感到说不出的厌倦.

sentences.en: Bicker: To engage in a petty, bad - tempered quarrel; squabble.
sentences.cn: 发生口角: 因坏脾气引起的小的争吵; 为琐事争吵.

sentences.en: Don't interfere in a matrimonial squabble – let husband and wife fight it out among themselves.
sentences.cn: 夫妻吵架不用劝——让他们自己争辩个明白好了.

sentences.en: Don't interfere in their squabble -- let them fight it out among themselves.
sentences.cn: 不要干预他们的争吵 -- 让他们争个水落石出.
不要为一点小事就吵起来.

sentences.en: He always likes to squabble with others about petty matters.
sentences.cn: 他总爱为些小事而和他人争吵.

sentences.en: Just a squabble every and then when someone was off.
sentences.cn: 当有人离开时总会有一些口角发生.

sentences.en: Mother is devoted to Dad although they squabble all the time.
sentences.cn: 妈妈深爱着爸爸，虽然他们总是为琐事争吵。

sentences.en: She always made me smile, even after Sis and I had just had a big squabble.
sentences.cn: 即使我刚和姐姐大吵了一场,她也总能使我舒怀微笑.

sentences.en: The bribery scandal sparked a squabble between radicals and moderates in the parliament.
sentences.cn: 这个贿赂丑闻在国会激进派和温和派之间引发了一场争吵.

sentences.en: Then there was a squabble on the landing.
sentences.cn: 不一会,楼梯口上传来一阵吵闹声.

sentences.en: Then, seemingly on the spur of the moment, Morty started a squabble.
sentences.cn: 后来，似乎一时冲动，莫迪和我发生口角。

sentences.en: There have been minor squabbles about phone bills.
sentences.cn: 为电话账单已闹过口角。

sentences.en: To engage in a petty, bad - tempered quarrel; squabble.
sentences.cn: 因坏脾气引起的小的争吵; 为琐事争吵.

sentences.en: Tom keep squabble with his sister about who is going to use the bicycle.
sentences.cn: 汤姆跟妹妹都争著要骑那辆自行车.

trans.tran_cn: （为小事而）争论，吵嘴，搅乱（排好的铅字）
